greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Regular triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of unlabeled balanced rooted semi-identity trees with n >= 1 nodes and depth 0 <= k < n.
comment: A rooted tree is a semi-identity tree if the non-leaf branches of the root are all distinct and are themselves semi-identity trees. It is balanced if all leaves are the same distance from the root.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..200, flattened
Gus Wiseman, Unlabeled balanced rooted semi-identity trees with 12 nodes, organized by depth.
